meanings.definition: Lacking intensity of color or brightness
meanings.sent1: The sky grew pallider as the sun set behind the mountains.
meanings.sent2: Her pallider complexion indicated she was feeling unwell.
meanings.sent3: The clown's makeup made his face look even pallider under the stage lights.
meanings.sent4: The once vibrant painting now appeared pallider after years of exposure to sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden looked even pallider under the gray clouds.

meanings.sent1: The pallider stars were barely visible through the city lights.
meanings.sent2: The pallider hues of autumn signaled the arrival of winter.
meanings.sent3: The old photograph had become even pallider with age.
meanings.sent4: His memories of the event grew pallider as time passed.
meanings.sent5: The pallider glow of the dying fire painted shadows on the walls.
